channel.title: 'javac' is not recognized as a internal or external command
channel.description: Ok, So, when I go into my command prop and type in javac, it says 'javac' is not recognized as a internal or external command, operable program, or batch file. Wheneber i looked in my java folder, I dont even see javac in there... And know, ever since I've tryed to download java and all that, Ipconfig isnt a command either. Im using java 6u18. Someone help?

item.title: 'javac' is not recognized as a internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Classic Rune Classic
item.description:
@Rune_Classic wrote:

Yes, I have them set.

Read full topic
item.source: 'javac' is not recognized as a internal or external command

item.title: 'javac' is not recognized as a internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

[quote=“Rune Classic, post:3, topic:326143”][quote author=Fox0wnage link=topic=422555.msg3101847#msg3101847 date=1263762039]
Make sure you have downloaded JDK and have JRE. If you have them and it’s still not working then you must set your Environmental Variables. There’s a tutorial on starting a private server, I would read that to learn how to set them if I were you.
[/quote]

I have them both downloaded[/quote]
Alright, you may have them downloaded, but as stated before I say to set your Environmental Variables. If you have then please tell me.

Read full topic
item.source: 'javac' is not recognized as a internal or external command

@Rune_Classic wrote:

Wheneber i looked in my java folder, I dont even see javac in there… And know, ever since I’ve tryed to download java and all that, Ipconfig isnt a command either. Im using java 6u18.
Someone help?
